Battle Effects.name: 战斗效果
Battle Effects.description: See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{大规模作战} for when to use this table.

results.2-2: Inspire: The warrior battles valiantly, inspiring the troops and urging them to fight on despite their injuries. Her side immediately recovers one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{兵力标识}.
results.3-4: Terrorize: The fighter’s fury terrorizes her foes. The enemy commander subtracts 2 from his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂} roll if forced to test @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{士气} this round.
results.5-9: Valor: The warrior’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.援助]{援助} adds +2 to the commander’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.作战]{作战} roll as usual.
results.10-11: Slaughter: The foe reels at the champ­ion’s onslaught. Subtract 2 from the enemy commander’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.作战]{作战} total.
results.12-12: An Army of One: Tales will be told and songs sung of the warrior’s epic feats this day. The enemy army loses a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{兵力标识} immediately (this doesn’t subtract from his Battle roll but does cause a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{士气} check even if he wins).

Creative Combat.name: 创新战斗
Creative Combat.description: Creative Combat enhances a pulp-style game with additional benefits for those who Test with a raise. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.创新战斗]{创新战斗} on when to use these rules.

results.2-2: Second Wind: The foe’s reaction gives your hero hope or allows her to catch her breath. She may remove a level of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏} or a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤} (her choice). If she doesn’t have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤}, the enemy is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇} instead.
results.3-3: Inspiration: Fate favors the bold. The clever hero receives a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点}.
results.4-5: Double Whammy: The target is both @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神与脆弱}.
results.6-8: Shaken: The foe is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇}.
results.9-10: Setback: The target suffers a setback of some sort. She might fall off a ledge, lose the confidence of her minions (who then desert her), take a rash but foolish action, or simply lose her next turn as she attempts to recover from whatever situation she finds herself in.
results.11-11: Insight: The hero has new insight into the target’s nature. Once during this encounter, she may add +d6 to any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{特性投骰} made to directly attack, affect, or damage the same foe. If rolled a second time in the same encounter, the foe is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇} instead.
results.12-12: Seize the Moment: After the hero resolves this turn, she immediately gets an entire additional turn. This includes movement as well! She may use the turn to go on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机} if she wishes.

Dynamic Backlash.name: 动态反冲
Dynamic Backlash.description: Normally, a Critical Failure on an arcane skill results in Fatigue. If the GM feels it should have a higher price, use this table instead. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动态反冲]{动态反冲}

results.2-2: Catastrophe: Something goes terribly wrong. The GM must decide what, but some ideas are a new and permanent Minor @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘}, the inability to use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术} for several days, or an explosion of some sort. The backlash should be thematic if possible. If the hero tampers with dark forces for his abilities, for example, he might become corrupted or summon something sinister into the world. If he’s a weird scientist the device might explode for 3d6 damage in a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{中型爆散盖板}, or he might develop a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.怪癖]{怪癖}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.恐惧症]{恐惧症}, or other “madness.”
results.3-3: Backfire: The power succeeds as with a raise but affects a different target with the worst possible results. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭} hits a random friend, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{提升特性} increases an enemy’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能或属性}, etc. If there’s no likely target, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑} instead. If the power has a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{持续时间} other than Instant, it lasts its full term and can only be negated by d@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.破袪]{破袪} (the caster can’t voluntarily end it herself).
results.text: Short Circuit: The power fails but the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{获得奇术点} allocated to it are spent, along with an additional 1d6 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{获得奇术点} .
results.6-8: Stunned: The caster is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑}. She subtracts 2 from arcane skill rolls for the rest of the encounter (the penalty remains –2 even if she gets this result again).
results.9-10: Overload: The character’s synapses crackle and overload with power. He takes 2d6 damage plus the cost of the power in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{获得奇术点} , including any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术调整]{奇术调整} the player declared.
results.11-11: Fatigue: The character suffers @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏}.
results.12-12: Overcharge: The power draws ambient energy from the air, automatically suc­ceeding against the target with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良} and costing the caster no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{获得奇术点}!

Fear Table.name: Fear Table
Fear Table.description: Change the Roll Table Formula to include the modifier, like "d20+2". Or for easier rolls, click @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-macros.Fear Table]{恐惧表宏} to be prompted for a modifier. If you did use the Macro to get this result, please disregard this message. You can read more about the Fear table by clicking @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恐惧]{这里}

results.1-3: Adrenaline Surge: The hero’s “fight” response takes over. He acts as if he had a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{鬼牌} this action!
results.4-6: Distracted: The hero is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神} until the end of his next turn.
results.7-9: Vulnerable: The target is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱} until the end of his next turn.
results.10-12: Shaken: The character is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇}.
results.13-13: The Mark of Fear: The hero is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑} and suffers some cosmetic physical alteration—a white streak forms in his hair, his eyes twitch constantly, or some other minor physical alteration manifests.
results.14-15: Frightened: The character gains the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.犹豫不决]{犹豫不决} @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘} for the remainder of the encounter. If he already has it, he’s Panicked instead.
results.16-17: Panicked: The character immediately moves his full @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速} plus running die away from the danger and is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇}.
results.18-19: Minor Phobia: The character gains a Minor @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.恐惧症]{恐惧症} @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘} somehow associated with the trauma.
results.20-21: Major Phobia: The character gains the Major @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.恐惧症]{恐惧症} Hindrance.
results.22-9999: Heart Attack: The hero is so over­whelmed with fear that his heart stutters. He must make an immediate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力} roll at –2. If successful, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑}. If he fails, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化} and dies in 2d6 rounds. In the latter case, a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗} roll at –4 saves his life, but he remains @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化}. He may be treated normally thereafter.

Injury Table.name: 创伤表
Injury Table.description: If @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化} and failed Vigor roll, roll on this table.

results.2-2: Unmentionables: If the injury is permanent, reproduction is out of the question without miracle surgery or magic. There is no other effect from this result.
results.3-4: Arm: The victim can no longer use his left or right arm (rolled randomly if not targeted).
results.5-9:
Guts: Your hero catches one in the core. Your roll was [[1d6]]:

1–2 Broken: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧} reduced a die type (minimum d4).

3–4 Battered: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力} reduced a die type (minimum d4).

5–6 Busted: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量} reduced a die type (minimum d4).
results.10-11: Leg: Gain the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.缓慢]{缓慢} @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘} (Minor), or Major if already @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.缓慢]{缓慢} or injured in either leg.
results.12-12:
Head: A grievous injury to the head. Your roll was [[1d6]] (see below):

1–3 Hideous Scar: Your hero now has the Ugly (Major) @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘}.

4–5 Blinded: An eye is damaged. Gain the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.独眼]{独眼} @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘} (or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.目盲]{目盲}d @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘} if he only had one good eye).

6 Brain Damage: Massive trauma to the head. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧} reduced one die type (min d4).

Out of Control.name: 失控
Out of Control.description: Damage caused by an Out of Control roll doesn’t trigger another Out of Control roll, but a Wound triggers a Critical Hit as usual. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具{机动技能} to learn more

results.2-2: Major Collision: Everyone in the vehicle is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神}. It takes d4 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤} and one@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.载具重创]{重创}.
results.3-4: Minor Collision: The vehicle takes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤} and a@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.载具重创]{重创}.
results.5-9: Distracted: Ground vehicles spin out or skid. Airplanes or spaceships stall, slide, flip, or roll unexpectedly. Everyone on board is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神} until the end of their next turn.
results.10-11: Vulnerable: The vehicle and everyone on board is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱} until the end of their next turn.
results.12-12: Glitch: Something is jarred loose or breaks from rough handling. The vehicle suffers a@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.载具重创]{重创} (reroll Crew results).

Reaction Table.name: 态度表
Reaction Table.description: The GM can use the table below to roll or choose a character or group's initial attitude. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉} on how to use this table.

results.2-2: Hostile: The target is openly hostile. He may attack if possible, or other­wise betray, report on, or hinder the party at the first opportunity. He doesn’t help without an over­whelming reward or threat of some kind.
results.3-3: Unfriendly: The character isn’t interested in helping unless he has little choice and/or is offered a substantial payment or reward.
results.4-5: Uncooperative: The target isn’t interested in getting involved unless there’s a significant advantage to himself.
results.6-8: Neutral: The character has no particular attitude toward the group. He expects fair payment for any sort of favor or information.
results.9-10: Cooperative: The character is gener­ally sympathetic. He helps if he can for a small fee, favor, or kindness.
results.11-11: Friendly: The individual goes out of his way for the hero. He likely does simple tasks for very little, and is willing to do more dangerous tasks for fair pay or other favors.
results.12-12: Helpful: Helpful: The target is anxious to help the hero and probably does so for little or no reward.

Vehicle Critical Hits.name: 载具重创
Vehicle Critical Hits.description: See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具{追逐与载具}

results.2-2: Scratch and Dent: The attack just scratches the paint or passes clean through the body without hitting anyone or anything vital. There’s no permanent damage.
results.3-3: Guidance/Traction: The wheels, tracks, sails, thrusters, etc. have been hit. Reduce @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具]{操控性} by one each time this occurs (to a maximum penalty of –4).
results.4-5: Locomotion: The engine, mainsails, boiler, etc., is hit. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具]{最高速度} is reduced by 10% each time this occurs (to a minimum of 60% Top Speed).
results.6-8: Chassis: The vehicle suffers a hit in the body with no special effects.
results.9-10: Crew: For direct damage, subtract the vehicle’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具]{护甲} (if appropriate for the victim’s position) and apply the remainder to a random crew member. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果} weapons affect everyone in a section determined by the GM. If this is the result of a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具{碰撞}, the occupants are Shaken.
results.11-11: Weapon: A random weapon is destroyed. If there is no weapon, this is a Chassis hit instead
results.12-12: System: The vehicle loses an electronic system, its airbags, or some other system determined by the GM. If it doesn’t have any special features, treat this as a Chassis hit instead.
